title: Restrictions of f
text: Are there any restrictions to the domain for the function $$f(x)=\sqrt{2x+1}$$?
choices: Cannot take the square root of negatives
Can only take the square root of positives

title: Restrictions of f

title: Restrictions of $$\frac{f}{g}$$
text: Since f's domain is $$[\frac{-1}{2},\infty)$$ and g's domain is $$x \neq \frac{1}{3}$$, the final domain will be where both statements are true.

title: Restrictions of $$\frac{f}{g}$$
text: For some interval [a,b] where c is between a and $$b$$, if $$x \neq c$$, then the interval would be [a,c) $$\cup$$ (c,b].
speech: For some interval [a,b] where c is between a and  b , if  x, is not equal to, c , then the interval would be [a,c)  union  (c,b].
